text: Hey i have a question. I got no anser. Where should i go with this?
Hi all, is it possible to auto-populate a form field using the `form` HubL Tag? It would be great if I can do something like this (instead of using a query param or javascript solution):
Hi there, does anyone know if it's possible to set a hubl dictionary value to a JS variable?

How do I update a specific value in a basic array like
```set array=['this','that','the other thing']```
change that to these…
```set array[2] = 'these'```
does anyone know anything about these var replacers?

it appears when sending an email it calculates ur module based on default values and then interpolates any values relating to to the var replacers rather than actually calculating based on the data being given

e.g.
{% set amount = deal.amount | float %}
{{ amount | pprint }} // will output null
{{ deal.amount| pprint  }} // will output deal amount

I want to `split()` a string value and loop through it however this is impossible because the loop will be iterating through null and then being interpolated by the var replacer instead of iterating through the splited list of items
it appears it can interpolate into statements but when you try pipe it into a filter it breaks
